post_text: Congratulations to our very first graduate Haley Javins! She completed her coursework and graduated last month. Haley has also completed dual enrollment courses and will receive the President's academic achievement award. She hopes to attend GNTC in the Fall. Great job Haley!
text: Congratulations to our very first graduate Haley Javins! She completed her coursework and graduated last month. Haley has also completed dual enrollment courses and will receive the President's academic achievement award. She hopes to attend GNTC in the Fall. Great job Haley!

post_text: Congratulations to these two students who have done an exceptional job demonstrating persistence! Persistence is perhaps the biggest key to success in online learning. Students who succeed with digital learning are those who are willing to tolerate technical problems, seek help when needed, work daily on every class, and persist through challenges. We are so proud of both of these young ladies and the persistence they have demonstrated through the COVID-19 pandemic. We are proud to announce the April student of the month Abby Dawson, and the May student of the month Kayla Carroll.
text: Congratulations to these two students who have done an exceptional job demonstrating persistence! Persistence is perhaps the biggest key to success in online learning. Students who succeed with digital learning are those who are willing to tolerate technical problems, seek help when needed, work daily on every class, and persist through challenges. We are so proud of both of these young ladies and the persistence they have demonstrated through the COVID-19 pandemic. We are proud to announce the April student of the month Abby Dawson, and the May student of the month Kayla Carroll.

post_text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Monday, June 1 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
April 17 at 1:38 PM Â·

MECHS is working diligently to provide the safest option for a commencement ceremony for the spring of 2020. Graduation was originally scheduled for May 30th; however, due to the current situation with COVID-19 graduation will either be postponed until later this summer or we will host a virtual ceremony. With that being said, Dr. Lovell and everyone at MECHS would prefer to host traditional graduation with virtual being the absolute last resort. We are working with the University of North Georgia for potential new dates and times. Once we have more guidance from Governor Kemp and the Department of Education, we will communicate that to all of you. Please be assured that graduation will be happening whether at a later date or virtually.

If you find yourself feeling isolated, worried about your family, concerned about being alone at home with children for days or weeks, or in need of essential resources like food or funds for utilities and rent, please call 1-800-CHILDREN (244-5373). MECHS counselors are also available to families and students during this time. Letâ€™s navigate this new normal together.

post_text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.
text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

post_text: Chattooga County Schools will provide meals for students during the school closure beginning Monday, March 16. Meals will be available for a daily pick up at each Chattooga County school from 10 am â€“ 12 noon M-F. There will be a drive-thru area marked. Please stay in your vehicle and you will be given meals based on the number of children in your vehicle. Anticipate the possibility of a brief wait in line.
